Reviews.Content: We had a really good stay at this hotel. Although the hotel could use some renovations, the service was awesome and it was very clean. The rooms were nice and the bathrooms were really clean and of course the beds were great! There service was great from check-in to check out. During our stay, my husband got sick and the staff went above and beyond to help clean up the entire room in the late hours of the night. I couldnt handle the mess and they cleaned everything. The night Maintenance Manager (I think) was extremely nice and reassured me that they wold handle it for me and treated me like I was at a five star hotel. I appreciated it more than they know! All in all a really nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Customer Service and Event Venue I Have Experienced”
Reviews.Author: Manonamsn
Reviews.Content: I did an event at this hotel at the end of Nov and had an usually high amount of feedback from our guests on the food that was served and the hotel itself. I myself was completely satisfied with the service and working with the events and catering staff was great. Recently I needed a very last minute event venue and called the Sheraton up a few days before our event. They totally took care of us and were completely accommodating. They are a total pleasure to work with and are always very bright and friendly. The day of the event I was running around and was doing some last minute things. At one point I went to get some coffee and tea from some special guests, went to the cafe off the lobby and saw that it was closed. I turn around and there was already someone standing there asking what help I needed and was onto it in an instant. The Food and Beverage Manager opened up the cafe, made all of the coffee/tea, offered to help take it to the meeting room and was completely service-oriented and I must say I was pretty impressed. Later he saw me rushing through the lobby (I must have looked a bit stressed) and caught up with me just to ask if I needed something. In dealing with many hotel staff and representatives in the past its a rare thing when you feel like a friend rather than one of the of countless "clients" they deal with day in and day out. This hotel is definitely a venue I will work with in the future. Also, the Sheraton is one of my favorite hotel chains to stay in so I also highly recommended them.

Reviews.Title: “ACSF 2011 Leadership Symposium a success at the Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: Marjorie31310
Reviews.Content: Yesterday was the first annual ACSF Symposium held at the Sheraton Crescent. After a long search for a venue this summer to find the right home for our symposium, especially a venue that can accommodate our impending growth, I was lucky to come upon the Sheraton Crescent. Your hospitality, knowledge and helpfulness struck me immediately Nicole Hobbs. You might think this would be something that most establishments would value in someone that represented their organization, but it is not what I found. Most other places I visited left me weary as to whether or not I can trust them to do as I expected someone to do for this conference. You immediately put all my fears to rest and somehow I knew we would be in excellent hands to work with the Sheraton Crescent. Media for such an event is critical. You will succeed/fail by this avenue. It is one of my greatest concerns yearly for this event. Again we were made to feel so confident in Bob Grimm’s abilities. He was so present and accommodating to my staff and our guests. He worked wonderfully with Paul Raia who was assigned to deal with our media needs on the ACSF side. Together they worked to execute the day seamlessly. Because it was our first year at the Sheraton, I really felt this was the year to “work out the kinks” for our future symposiums. There were NO KINKS on year one. I would say that is a tremendous accomplishment and one ACSF could not have achieved if not for your OUTSTANDING work and cooperation. We are so grateful to you both and your staff. With many thanks, Marjorie

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: orelas1
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Phoenix and I don't have any major complaints about this hotel. Very good air conditioning--you immediately tell the difference when you walk in (or out! I went in July!). The staff was very hospitable and professional. Everything was clean. The dining... I wish there were more frills to it. It's a nice restaurant but a limited menu. Oh well, you can't have everything, and besides I got a great deal on the price. I lost several dollars because the vending machine gave out the wrong drink and I wish the staff could have warned me I wouldn't like one of the taxi companies they recommended. I think this hotel would be great for a family vacation, especially if you rent a car. It's right next to a highway out (like to go to the Grand Canyon?), there's a decent budget amusement park with a nice charm and an EXCELLENT (and generally inexpensive) arcade right across the highway that I went to every day, and there's an indoor mall pretty close by, too. They had activities and movies by the pool. But best if you drive to get where you need to go. I mostly did tours that picked me up from the hotel, but otherwise I walked or took public transit everywhere. Walking was tough in the heat, and the public transit system has very bad hours. So in some respects a downtown hotel would have been better for me.

Reviews.Title: “Third Thursdays Event - An Evening to Remember”
Reviews.Author: ginlof
Reviews.Content: This was my first time attending the Third Thursday Event. This event was designed to get the community involved into local charity. I had a great time visiting with collegues, enjoying the dining and lounge experience while listening to some great music. The environment was warm and friendly and the service was wonderful. I would definately recommend the Third Thiursday's experience to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: deevans3
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I were travelling to California and stopped for the night in Phoenix. We knew of the Sheraton and had been by before, but never stayed. We decided to stop and are so glad we did! They happened to be having "Third Thursday" going on in the courtyard that evening with live music, cash bars, hors d'oeurves and mingling. What a wonderful idea for a crisp fall evening! We met such nice people, including many staff members, and enjoyed the gathering. The rooms were clean, the staff were all friendly from front desk to restaurant to gift shop, and the Sheraton Sweet Sleeper was hard to get out of. THIS is where we'll stay any time we pass through Phoenix!

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Diggerdog63
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Crescent many times and they never disappoint: clean, bright rooms with fantastic views, great food, awesome gym and pet friendly. I always stay here when I come to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bebe55
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Crescent in early November. The staff is probably the best staff of any hotel I have been to- from the front desk to the very nice lady working in the snack shop to the shuttle drivers. Beds are great, rooms are clean, work out room is well equipped and pool area is fantastic. There was some noise from the freeway so you might want to pick your room accordingly. The hotel shuttle van will take you anywhere in a 5 mile radius so we did not even have to rent a car, although after 4 days we were feeling a little restricted. Within the 5 miles though, there is a large mall and several very good restaurants. We went to Bobby Qs (ribs are really good)and Pappadeux, which was an excellent seafood restaurant ( be sure to try the creme brulee). Took a side trip to the Grand Canyon with Detours and this was well worth the time and money. Detours even picks you up at the hotel, so once again- no rental car. All in all, this was a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Positive Experience”
Reviews.Author: jkp0099
Reviews.Content: I am having such a positive experience that I am choosing to write this review before I check out. Upon check-in, I was welcomed with a smile and information, and it has been consistent throughout the stay. I have eaten at the restaurant twice, and both times received excellent service from Chad. I served years ago, but the customer service aspect has stayed with me, and I have a hard time when I do not receive the level of service I anticipate, but Chad has been consistent in providing it to my collegue and myself. The room is nice and clean. The meeting rooms are also nice. The moveable walls are successful at blocking the noise of the adjacent meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service - Home-Away-From-Home”
Reviews.Author: PamW_11
Reviews.Content: My situation is unusual, while in the process of relocating we have chosed the Sheraton Crescent for his temporary home-away-from-home. They have been extremely accomodating, and have provided above & beyond customer service for his stay. I appreciate that I can rely on Tammi Truax, Manager Sales to take care of all my business guests. We have built a tremendous partnership with integrity, reliability and loyalty. Once I've given our out of state guest her contact information, I have no worries that Tammi will accomodate to the best of her ability.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was excellent!”
Reviews.Author: TerReese1
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was really amazing - excellent customer service all around. The room was very nice, clean and comfortable, and the balcony was a an added plus. This was a very convenient location - easy access for getting around. I stayed here for a conference and the services for that was good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent is as Excellent Does!”
Reviews.Author: Durks63
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about maximizing the customer experience! It is clear this hotel hires, trains, and stresses the importance of customer satisfaction to the entire staff. Every staff member genuinely cares about the customer experience and is ready and willing to meet every expectation. The rooms are modern and clean. The grounds are manicured and the pool, gym and courtyard are spotless. This property is business traveler and family friendly . I would highly recommend this property!!!

Reviews.Title: “A 4 Diamond Hotel at a 3 Diamond Price”
Reviews.Author: joelhdennis
Reviews.Content: We were in the process of moving and are SPG members, so we used points to pay for the stay. This hotel is a steal for SPG members. We have stayed at the "W" in Scottsdale, and the attentiveness and service provided by the staff of the Sheraton Crescent are superior to the Scottsdale "W". The food is superior and the restaurant staff is also superior to the Scottsdale "W". Since we were moving to Phoenix, we had our dog, a Shiba Inu with us. He was welcomed by staff and received wonderful acceptance by staff and guests. The hotel is at the Dunlop exit off of I-17 in Phoenix and we felt safe and secure at this hotel. We had a wonderful experience at the Sheraton Crescent and recommend anyone with a family and/or pet to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Sheraton Crescent was extremely nice and very reasonably priced.”
Reviews.Author: cmcdonald046
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while attending some business meetings being held at the hotel facility. Everything about the hotel was very nice, clean, and comfortable, and the rooms were very reasonably priced. The hotel staff were extremely nice and professional when I had questions about sending mail, getting to a Diamonbacks game, and locating a particular meeting room one morning. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to this area.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ngehlot
Reviews.Content: Good business trips and weekend. Its kind of old inhot Arizona but well maintained. Loved free acess to internet in rooms and also computer centres but wish there was a printer. Very friendly staff who goes all the way to help you ........ Decent price if booked in advance and has a restaurant and also a bar but no nigth life .... Step put to foro clubs and run in to stangers in Phoenix, Arizona .....

Reviews.Title: “Cleanliness, friendliness, and helpfulness is the best.”
Reviews.Author: BabyBsober
Reviews.Content: I was part of a Conference that went off vey well with the hugh amount the staff provided. I live in the area but chooswe to stay one night there and loved it. The room was cozy comfy and i even ordered room service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: iMac007
Reviews.Content: The property was situated in a goof location to access many of the golf courses wiht out having to drive very far in any one direction. The staff where very friendly and and responded quickly to all of my request.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property, Clean, Friendly Staff and great fun for families!”
Reviews.Author: tsciatto
Reviews.Content: We spent an night at this hotel and it was a really great experience. Everything was great and clean. Everyone seemed to be having a great time. They played a movie in the pool in the evening. Great family fun for a quick get away from everday life and the price was affordable. We were so impressed that we are going back for our Anniversary for a get away!!! I looked at other hotels in the area and for a few dollars less we could have got a double room in which one of the beds was a sleeper sofa. The beds were really comforable and I am handicapped and I felt great in the morning. Most hotels offer very few channels to watch but here we had a lot to choose from. Highly recommend staying here for vacation or just a quick get away. Good for our local economy!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: zcj
Reviews.Content: I'm glad we stayed at the Sheraton Crescent. The location was great. Upon check-in the hotel manager was friendly and took his time checking us in. We had a great view and got the best rest we'd had in a long time, especially after a long drive. Every staff person we spoke with was courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: TraySea4
Reviews.Content: Wow, what can I say. My family and I stayed here for just one night, the last night of a weeklong vacation & we received the best customer service treatment ever. Robert at check-in was the best, gave us a warm welcome (we had just drove 4+ hrs) and joked with everyone in my family. The bellman was wonderful as well, talking with the kids and asking about our travels. Once we settled in the family headed to the awesome twisty slide and pool. Afterwards, we headed back to our room, there was a nice "hand written" note w/chocolate covered strawberries waiting in our room. I thought our stay was just one last place to rest our heads before the next all daylong plane trip home, I was wrong. My family was treated with spectular service. Would love to stay at a Sheraton again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is Not a Forgotten Art!”
Reviews.Author: rudynhlb
Reviews.Content: This was the third conference I've planned at this hotel, and they outdo themselves each time! It's rare to find staff (Megan, the Catering Manager) who are a joy to work with during the planning and who have such attention to detail! The Banquet staff were equally exceptional in their attentiveness. Our speakers felt spoiled-and loved it! We had a few special dietary requests, and they honored each with lovely alternative options. In fact, our participants were jealous of those gluten-free desserts specially prepared by the Head Chef! Whatever we needed was provided, and service was prompt, including last minute audio-visual assistance. This was the first time i had an opportunity to personally experience being a guest in the hotel, and I was pleased to find that the rooms were spacious. In the little time I had to enjoy my room, I loved that there were free yoga and pilates workouts available on the TV! The computers available for use by hotel guests in the lobby were also quite convenient. Loved the ambience of the whole hotel, including the relaxed atmosphere of the lounge. Another thing I really appreciated was the hotel's "green" program, where they give you a gift card you can use to spend in their restaurant or gift shop when you waive housekeeping service. What a cool idea and it saved me some money on dinner! Great place for a business meeting or to bring the family for a weekend getaway. I highly recommend the Sheraton Crescent. I will definitely give them a call the next time I have an event to plan! Thanks to the entire staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Family and location”
Reviews.Author: TTnC4Me
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 (kids 12, 10, 7) stayed at this hotel just recently and we were more than happy. We booked on points, so not sure of the value, but the location was great and so was the hotel. We stayed on both our arrival into Arizona, then again on our departure 7 days later. We stayed here in route to Northern Arizona and was the perfect location for our family to rest for the night. We arrived early (before noon) and we were able to check in early, which was wonderful. We had a pool view room on the 6th floor and enjoyed the spacious, 2 double bed layout in both rooms. The bathroom is a single (with toilet, sink & shower in one space). The shower water was hot, and powerful. The rooms were clean and orderly. The television received adequate channels and included cartoon network, for the kids. The kids LOVED the slide into the pool at a separate location than the main pool. We arrived on a Sunday and not sure if that made a difference, but the kids loved the Watermelon eating contest, the music, the free pool toys and floats that were available to the guests. The adults loved the plentiful chairs, the free internet access, and the free self parking. On our 2nd stay, we enjoyed the movie by the pool on the following Sunday evening. Being gold members we were delighted with the breakfast lounge on the club level our first stay, and were happy to receive vouchers to the restaurant (in leiu of the unavailable club buffet) our 2nd stay. The food in the restaurant was very good and plentiful. Prices were average, ranging from $3 drinks to $18-$20 entrees at dinner and $8-$10 entrees at breakfast. Kids meals are $5 breakfast and I don't quite remember dinner prices ($6.99?). The staff was extremely nice....everyone from housekeeping, to the pool attendants. They were very aware of the guests and were sure to keep the kids in check at the slide area and at the pool. The 2nd stay, we were on the "mountain view" side I believe - it faced the highway anyway. No noise from the highway, although it's quite close. The only noise I recall was from a siren a couple of times, but that can happen anywhere probably. The location is great.... right across the highway from a shopping mall, and most major restaurants. We were about 20 minutes from the airport (car rental place) and right on the highway to our next destination - Sedona - then the Grand Canyon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay During 4th Of July”
Reviews.Author: mhhiggins2008
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Crescent During the 4th of July Holiday! It was absolutely wonderful, and we enjoyed our time there. We wish we didn't have to leave and can't wait until our next visit. Its a wonderful hotel with all sorts of things going on for adults and children!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: cruzur
Reviews.Content: It's taken me a long time to right this review, it was so upsetting. We flew in late at night for Spring Training. I researched which hotel to stay at the first couple nights that wasn't far from the airport or Peoria. I liked the location and pool area. I booked through Priceline. We took a cab to the hotel and got there about 11 p.m. We went to check in and were told they didn't have a room reserved for us, I showed them our confirmation and she wouldn't even look at me and said sorry but they had no rooms available. I asked her what were we suppose to do, it was 11 p.m., we had just flown in from Seattle, and taken a cab to the hotel - she said there was nothing they could do it was a third party reservation. I then asked her to help us find a room somewhere else, she never once looked me in the eye or showed any concern for our experience. She finally went into an office came back with the name of a hotel, and I asked if their shuttle service could take us there, she went back into the office and when she came back out she said the hotel didn't have any rooms, and in fact there was nothing avaiable because it was spring break. And walked away. I walked back up and waited for her, and again asked what we were suppose to do, she said she would get me set up with a temporary password on their internet to look for a room! That took forever. While waiting one family came to the desk because they were upset the pool slide was shut down, and stated that was why they chose the hotel, and then two more families came up to check in and both had reserved rooms with two beds and were told they only had rooms with king beds left. I know things happen, but in each case the front desk was not apologetic or helpful to these people, I had never seen such poor service. I called Priceline and got no answer, so I finally just got out my iphone located a hotel, I asked if they could call us a cab, she just walked away, so I looked up a cab on my iphone and we left the hotel. The next day I called Priceline and told them our story - they couldn't believe we had been treated so poorly, that the hotel was suppose to find us a room at another hotel, if the rate was higher pick up the difference and supply us with transportation at their cost. They contacted the hotel and were told there were no rooms available, and the manager was out, they would check back with us Monday after they spoke to the manager. We were contacted Monday and told to submit our receipts for our room and taxi and that the hotel would pick up the difference. Well the hotel was the same price, and we didn't have a receipt for the taxi because we paid cash. We ended up at the ramanda by the airport, and they were wonderful and offered us free breakfast buffet in the morning for all the hassle we had gone through. Every experience has a learning opportunity, and I found out that if you book third party, and hotel doesn't have your room and you have proof of a reservation, they are obligated to find you a room at another hotel and transportation to that hotel! The only good thing was we had not been billed for the hotel yet, so we didn't have to fight to get our money back! We stayed in 5hotels during this trip (Phoenix, Peoria, Sedona, Laughlin and Las Vegas - we aren't picky people nor hard to get along with, I understand things can go wrong, but on a scale from 1 to 5 the Sheraton didn't even get on the scale with the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff Makes a Beautiful Hotel Even Better”
Reviews.Author: BBZ257
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sheraton Crescent in Phoenix with my grandmother. We thoroughly enjoyed the beautiful hotel, everything was amazing. Unfortunately, our trip was cut short when she had a medical emergency. If it had not been for the assistance, quick thinking, fast acting, impeccable professionalism, kind words and support of the amazing staff there, I do not know how we would have gotten through the entire ordeal. Everyone at the Sheraton Crescent was instrumental in making a personally traumatic situation as bearable as possible. We will always be grateful for everything they did to help us get through it. The help and attention we received goes so far beyond customer service, that words escape me.

Reviews.Title: “the garden area is a great place to have a night time reception”
Reviews.Author: bud2430
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton met and exceeded our expectations with our wedding reception. The garden was absolutely amazing with our lanterns and other decorations that the staff helped set up. The hotel was very accommodating to what we wanted to do in terms of ideas, design, and everything else. You definitely get your moneys worth at the Sheraton, it may seem like a lot to pay for in the beginning but after everything is said and done I am was more than satisfied with everything. The wait staff was extremely friendly and the reception coordinator Meagan did a wonderful job at making our wedding reception a beautiful event. I don't believe anything went wrong all night, it was all organized and well put together. The food was also very good as well as the cake we ordered which was included with the package. The complimentary room we received was on the top floor and had a beautiful view of the city, we took some wonderful pictures with our photographer up there. Definitely glad we decided to go with the Sheraton Crescent.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is better than stated in the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Malea
Reviews.Content: I'm really surprised to see some of the poor reviews on this hotel. My husband and I have stayed at this hotel on four separate occasions to visit family members in the area. We are Starwood members and have found excellent rates for the Sheraton club rooms (as low as 150.00 per night) I'm honestly a "picky" traveler, but find this hotel to be consistently comfortable, clean and the rooms are really quiet. The last time we stayed, one of the managers greeted us each morning at breakfast and overall, the customer service was wonderful. It's true that the selections at breakfast are not widely varied, but we found everything to be more than adequate, especially considering that the breakfast was included in our room rate. What was even more impressive was that the manager called us a month later to inquire about an "average" rating that we gave on an item which was included on the customer feedback form. Overall, our rating of the hotel was quite good, so I thought it was impressive that they take that much care with their customer's satisfaction. I know everyone has a different experience, but I am honestly surprised by the negative reviews on this hotel - we will definitely be returning to stay every time we are in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Otherwise, not that impressed!”
Reviews.Author: bogeyboi
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at this Sheraton on business and if you judged the place by the exterior and lobby, you'd think you're about to step into a 5-star resort. The grounds are very well kept and free parking is plus. Lobby is very inviting with an infinity-style waterfall and huge courtyard. You can tell the bar and restaurant areas were upgraded and also great service. Customer service here is as good as I've experienced at any Sheraton. My excitement about this place turns south when I enter my room. While it was a pretty nice size with flat=screen TV and sitting area, it's way outdated. Furniture, wall paper, carpet, and especially the bathrooms simply need a makeover. The bed was very comfortable, however, and AC worked very well (a must in Phoenix). Overall, it felt like I was staying in a 4 star hotel (lobby, bar, restaurant, exterior appearance) with 2 star accommodations (rooms and conference areas). Location is not the best either. If you don't eat at the restaurant in the hotel, your lunch options are few (and require a trip across very busy 4-lane traffic - at your own risk). However, you're only about 20 minutes from Scottsdale which is where you'll find the best of shopping, restaurants, and friendly people. If back in the Phoenix area, I'd probably stay at a property closer to Scottsdale. Not a bad hotel and the staff was excellent, but could be a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good...had a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: vivace21
Reviews.Content: I can't say I had a lot of complaints about this hotel. After staying at the Crescent for a week (business mixed with pleasure) I have looked at previous reviews and I find them to be a little too harsh. I will break it down by good and bad: Good - Lobby and grounds are pretty and well kept. If you drive you will find they have ample free parking. The pool area is relaxing and quiet, and there are several benches and shaded areas to sit. Tennis courts and workout facilities are nice. Everything is clean and the landscaping is pretty. The conference rooms where we had our meetings were spacious and kept at a comfortable temperature. They did a good job of having coffee and snacks available at all times. The rooms-comfortable and large enough to suit me. I did not think the decor was "dated" as so many stated. The balcony is too small to sit out on. The beds were great. The wireless worked fine. The room was clean enough but I have seen cleaner. Don't get me wrong- it was fine. I wished they would have vacumed but not a huge deal. They cleaned the bathroom well each day. I did not think the bathroom tile looked dated...I thought it was fine and I have seen much worse. Room service was prompt. The staff was friendly enough but I barely interacted with them. Bad - Very little negative to say. I would stay here again. My biggest complaint is beyond the control of the hotel--I just didn't care for the location. I would have liked to have been closer to Scottsdale and it is quite a hike. Other than that, you are right by 17 which will take you anywhere. Traffic can be congested near this hotel. I also thought the hotel cafe was kind of bland considering the high prices they charge but that is very typical of many hotels. I would not spend $17 for their breakfast. A real balcony with room to sit would have been appreciated. Other than that, this is a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, bad service”
Reviews.Author: SBB9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one weekend to go to a Dodger spring training game. We are SPG members and used our points, so we didn't have to pay for our stay. If we had to pay, we'd want our money back. The water slide was closed for repair, which really bummed us out. I love waterslides, and it's one of the reasons we chose this hotel. You would think they would repair the slide in the winter, not the spring, when the weather was absolutely gorgeous! Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The pool and spa were great (even without the slide). And the location of the hotel was great. But the perks end there. The elevator got stuck on the 5th floor. We went to the front desk to report the problem. Instead of being apologetic or thankful, the lady at the desk, named Pua, gave us an attitude. Then our electric key wouldn't let us into the gym. They say to access the gym from the second floor, but when you get to the second floor entrance, you have to take stairs down to the first floor. We went all the way down, and realized our key wouldn't work. Another guest was there, and her key didn't work either. So, we went back to Pua at the front desk. She was snotty with us. She took our key, gave it back to us, and told us to try again. We did. It still didn't work! We went back up to the front desk and back down to the gym again. Still no luck. Finally, another guest picked the lock and let us in. After our gym workout, our key wouldn't let us into our room! So, we had to go back to Pua. You would think she would give a care! But nope. Luckily another guy was there that time, and he went to our room with us to let us in and he gave us new keys. However, he never even asked for i.d. Scary to think that it's that easy to get into a room. The breakfast buffet at Indigo is gross. Not worth the $16.00 per person. And the little gift shop serves Starbucks coffee but has only person working there. We went down to quickly buy some sunblock and had to wait over 20 minutes while she made drinks for other people at a snail's pace. The hotel is near the Metrocenter Mall, which is supposed to be a "premiere" shopping place. Most of the stores in it are empty or going out of business. We liked Phoenix. We loved the Dodger game! We liked our room. But the service, especially Pua, was substandard.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: plansalot
Reviews.Content: We have had 4 meetings at the Sheraton Crescent with numbers of 250+- general session + 11 breakouts. The clients have been very satisfied, so satisfied in fact that they told me to rebook for next year. The hotel and staff is exceptional, always eager to please. I don't have a hotel better than this one. This hotel makes me look "good"

Reviews.Title: “This is the worst Hotel! Cannnot believe it is a SHeraton!”
Reviews.Author: spenc34
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible. Run down, dirty, the most unhelpful staff I have ever encountered. In fact it is so bad even though I had pre-paid my room we changed hotels. Find it hard to believe this hotel meets the criteria required of a Sheraton. Will never stay there again. Pool & Hot tub so dirty didnt allow the kids to go in it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: bill3330
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sheraton Crescent for 5 nights for business. Excellent value found around 80 euros online. Hotel is situated directly by I-17 freeway, about 10-15 minutes north from downtown Phoenix. Let's say it : area is not very fancy but you are close to everything (downtown, malls, airport) except maybe Scottsdale. However, expect no scenic views from rooms : freeway, offices buildings... and that's all... I've read controversial reports on this website about this hotel. Let's try to balance evrything. Okay it is probably old (70's ? 80's for the original construction ?), but It has been nicely renovated (probably 10-15 years ago. Entrance is beautiful with lush tropical vegetation. Lobby is very nice but it lacks light... The rooms are large : lots of space (I had a standard with kingbed, club level rooms are said to be exactly the same comfort). Cleanliness is really good everywhere in the room, and bed is top confort. Yet, I agree with some reports : the bathrooms are so-so if you look at details such as the bath tiles which look quite dated... But who really cares ? Shower is ok, bath is ok, sunk is ok, marble is bright... what else would you need in your bathroom ? TV and Safebox in the room are OK, but the room lacks minibar (but ice & vending machine are on your floor). OK, a few words about the restaurant : I had the breakfast buffet : 10 USD, worth it but it was only available for sunday (probably due to the presence of families). On working days (monday to thursday I stayed) only "à la carte" breakfast (15-25 USD) was proposed to guests. Let's admit it : buffet or "à la carte", food was not really tasty (overcooked scramble eggs, orange juice with no taste, fresh fruits so-so..) but it's OK if you need to eat something before a busy day, and staff is really nice and professional. I never had dinners there : in fact the restaurant seemed closed, or with just one or two tables with guests... strange atmosphere (or no atmosphere at all !!!). About the gardens & pools : gardens are nice and pool is heated. The hot tub is really warm. I noticed that the waterslide tobbogan was closed due to maintenance. Two tennis courts available. Free covered parking for guests. Conclusion : an excellent value with really good service, even if it lacks somewhat some atmosphere. The place is perfect for business travelers. Families may find better resort oriented hotels in Scottsdale however. It is, let's say it, probably in the bottom of the Sheraton standards... But overall you get a lot here, for a very acceptable price. With a nice renovation of rooms, and some imaginative menus & atmosphere at the restaurant, it would become quite fancy...

Reviews.Title: “Great service, comfortable and clean!”
Reviews.Author: kykyHawaii
Reviews.Content: Pua at the Front Desk was great! Very friendly and was nice enough to give us a late check out because we were going to a funeral and weren't sure how long it would take. Our room was a nice size with super comfotable beds and a huge balcony over looking the city. Would deffinitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place But Don't Use The Shuttle Service!”
Reviews.Author: PAYSON10
Reviews.Content: My families stay was overall great but I had planned on the shuttle taking me and my family and a couple of my 5 year old daughters friends to take us to Chuck E. Cheese and picking us up after the party. The shuttle was very prompt when we needed to leave and had no problem making two trips to get my entire party (who all stayed at the hotel) to the pizza place on time. When it came time to leave, I called the hotel and asked for the shuttle to come and get us and I was told it would be 30 to 45 minutes, no problem. After and hour and 15 minutes I called the hotel back and asked for the bell desk and got no answer. I called back again and talked to the front desk and they transfered me again and still no answer. I called back again 15 minutes later and the front desk told me that they don't know why the bell desk is not answering and that I had better try to find a new way to get back. Not Good..... We called for the shuttle at 7:45pm and didn't get back to the hotel until after 9:00pm because we had to find a different way to get back and still the hotel had no real reason why no shuttle came to pick us up. What a mess with 8 children ( one of which is only 4 months old) and 5 adults. We tipped well on the first drop off and we have well behave children. Not a good experience and we feel like we were taken advatage of.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel should not be a representation of a Shearaton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lenaleet
Reviews.Content: Tried to have dinner Friday night at 7pm. There was only 1 waiter that made my party wait for 15 min to get seated, while there was only one table eating. When we sat the waiter informed us that there were only 7 salmon and 2 pork dishes left off the whole menu. Then when asked to recommen a good steak place, the waiter said Sizzler. Saturday when we tried to eat dinner there again, we asked if they had a full menu at 6pm the waiter said yes. Then when we asked if they had filet mingon, he said no, do you have the soup of the day, he said no. When we finally came back down to eat at 8pm the waiter said that because they were slow they shut the restaurant down so we had to eat at the bar lounge. We all had to eat our ribeyes on coffee tables. Then while we were drinking, the batendar shut us down at midnight because they said we had finished 3 bottle of black labeln take in mind that we were the only ones in the bar giving them business, and we were not loud or drunk. The gift shop closed at 4pm! the room service stops at 11. When we ordered roomservice in the morning, the pitchers of water were dirty, the fruit to decorate our plates were old and rotting, and the eggs that were suppose to be over easy were well done. Nothing seemed right at this hotel. The manager that had to relieve the bartender because it was slow, did not know how to make a malibu rum and pineapple. And she went to brag about how there hotel was still running well even though they are understaffed. i understand that when a company is slow and has to cut some corners, but this stay was rediculous!! If I would have know that my stay would have been like this I should have stayed at the other Shearaton in Phoneizx that was only 6 miles away!! There has to be standards that need to be uphelp when you are a major hotel. Shearaton needs to save even more money and shut this hotel down!! You are tanishing your name by leaving this hotel operating. There were 9 in our party and we have such a bad taste in our mouths from staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with the most amazing staff!!”
Reviews.Author: gdiventi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely amazing. The rooms were beautiful and the grounds were awesome too. The hotel had somewhat of a tropical feel to it. The staff were awesome and helped whenever we needed it. I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and Staff above and beyond !!”
Reviews.Author: travelqueenphxaz
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great !!! Beds very comfy and rooms nice. Staff friendly and helpful. Great location to shopping and resturants also rental car company on site. Hotel had Tennis Courts - pool with slide (kids spent all day on) and great fitness room. Weekend movies poolside. Had a fabulous time here will stay again !!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay at the Sheraton Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: timmyrTigard_Or
Reviews.Content: Great facility. I have stayed here before, but never has the attention to detail been so great! Indigo dining and the bar was fabulous. Everyone from the front desk to housekeeping was awesome. I look forward to my next visit to the Sheraton Crescent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Sheraton Crescent!”
Reviews.Author: greattobethere
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but great things to say about the Sheraton Crescent. We hold a large training program every September/October for 2 weeks. We have approximalety 60-65 participants and 15 staff members that attend. The staff is very accomadating during the entire 2 week stay. What ever we need....we receive....with a smile. The rooms are very nice. The beds are so comfy I don't want to go home! Love the pool.....great for long laps. I don't like being on the road for two weeks....but if I must....I'm thankful it's at the Sheraton Crescent. Thanks Sheraton Staff for all you do....while I'm there working...you make my job easy!

Reviews.Title: “It was a comfortable, relaxing stay, would recommend highly.”
Reviews.Author: bear1455
Reviews.Content: My most recent stay in Sept 09 was very pleasant. Accommodations and availabilty to staff was the best. I look forward to returning again in Sept 2010. Thanks for all your help. Mike Childers

Reviews.Title: “Just like family - and a great place to stay, too!”
Reviews.Author: MLBScouting
Reviews.Content: Our organization, MLB, has been planning and staying at the Sheraton for many years. The hotel has a lot to offer, but what sets it apart for us is not just the newly decorated lobby or the comfortable beds or the location, the best part of this hotel is the staff. Our event lasts 2 consectuive weeks every year.....when we show up we are treated as though we are family. Everyone from the maids to the banquet staff to the front desk to sales to the GM has always made our lengthy stay as comfortable as possible. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your events here”
Reviews.Author: rachplanner
Reviews.Content: I am the director of convention and meetings for an Indiana based organization. I recently had a group stay at the Sheraton Crescent for a meeting. Our people raved about their stay. We used meeting space, about 40 sleeping rooms and were even able to enjoy the club level breakfast and wifi. This hotel is a hidden gem. It has great outdoor space, pool, water slide, tennis courts (that you don’t have to pay an arm and a leg to use...its free), restaurant, business center, and a really nice lobby and check in area. The staff is friendly and went out of their way to make sure our event went well. We meet all over the country and I have to say the Crescent is now one of our favorite meeting spots. I rated them high in everything except location. They are a 15-20 minute drive from the airport, but the value and experience are worth the drive. They are close to a mall, food options and even a theme park. We didn't take in any attractions, but a few people at our meeting wished they would have brought their families along. What a neat place; family and business friendly. Enjoy your stay. Tell them Rachel sent you.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to crash if your too drunk to drive.”
Reviews.Author: MCohen
Reviews.Content: Decent Sheraton to crash when you are to tipsy to drive in Phoenix. Also good to bring a significant other along with you for the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable Good Quality Hotel - Not Outstanding but a good safe bet”
Reviews.Author: danintheus
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel often and although its not the cheapest in the area I keep coming back. Our company is re-negotiating its corporate rate and all my colleagues are adamant we want to keep this hotel. - Rooms are comfy and clean. TVs / Internet and so on always work - If a repair needs doing in the room it gets done. Fast - Staff are friendly and responsive - Restaurant and bar are decent, far better than average hotel offerings - pool is large and clean - Guest have access to new pcs and good printers in comfy business center area Is it a dream vacation.. well no, but its solid pleasant hotel which gives you what you need. If you're in the area stay here, you wont be sorry. There's water slide too but I cannot vouch for that!

Reviews.Title: “Dated Rooms”
Reviews.Author: BMD1
Reviews.Content: Exterior and lobby of hotel is nice. Rooms are very dated. Looks like they tried to update them, but did it on the cheap. Beds and bedding is new; chairs and opther furniture is shoddy, finish worn off, and wobbly. The bathroom has 1970's-era salmon pink tile that needs to go. No micro fridge, which is irritating based on the room price. 27" flat panel HDTV. Internet is not included in room price, $9.95/day, also irritating. Parking is free in the parking deck, not attached to the hotel. Lobby bar and restaurant was completely dead. I would not stay heren again until a complete overhaul of the rooms is done.

Reviews.Title: “Another Not Very Good Starwood Hotel in Greater Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: Flyintl
Reviews.Content: ALMOST BUT NOT QUITE A DECENT HOTEL Unfortunately, I have to align my review of this hotel with a number of other TripAdvisor reviewers. This hotel is okay and not even good. From the outside, it looks good, from the lobby it looks good and once in the rooms, it's fair. Nothing special in terms of furnishings, work area or bed and the tub is very outdated with pale peach colored tiles (like the ones my grandmother used to have in her house before she updated it in the 1980s. The fitness center is above average in size and equipment enough such that you can work out just as you do at your fitness club without the cost. Wifi costs $10 no matter whether you're on the Club Level or a Starwood Gold Member. This is one of those hotels that nickel and dime you for everything. Front desk service is just okay. They'll make you a key that doesn't work, bo you'll have to return to get a new key. The restaurant is dead, I mean, absolutely deserted and quiet (some people like that though) and that's on a Tuesday night at 7:15pm. If you want to stay at this level of hotel, try the Doubletree Phoenix Airport (they're nicer, treat you better and you get a larger room).

Reviews.Title: “Decent setup, rooms need a facelift”
Reviews.Author: lac14
Reviews.Content: The one thing I liked about the Sheraton is that everything is within one facility, as compared to several other properties in the area, mostly Hilton properties. The pool and gym is a quick walk downstairs. There is a concierge lounge with a friendly staff. The front desk staff was nice too. The lobby was okay but it seems like the rooms, even the ones on the club floor, can use some renovations. The setup is typical of a Sheraton with a bed, a seating area, a desk where I can turn the flat screen tv to face, and not much else. Not huge rooms but comfy for those who are used to staying at Sheraton properties. The week I was staying there, there were a bunch of teenagers for "MEP" training (military enlistment program) who occupied the pool at night and I'd see all over the property. I am not sure if this was a one time thing, as I saw a sign on the second floor for MEP. So they may be a regular fixture. The Sheraton may not be as high end as some of the Hilton brand properties in the area but for SPG fans, this is a convenient alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Loud Party, Garbage Around the Pool”
Reviews.Author: SeattleSmiths
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in March. There was a loud party next door until 2:00 a.m. and despite 4 calls to the supervisor, with 4 promises to shut it down, it never happened. The pool bar was closed and there was garbage left around the pool all night. The inside bar wasn't open until 6:00 p.m. Not sure why we stayed there --- what a dump.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuvMyVacation
Reviews.Content: Must say, I was a little concerned after seeing recent post from wedding party guest (although a careful read of the website will indicate that the spa is offsite). When we checked in, the staff was great -even helped print out my airline boarding pass. Our room was fantastic - HUGE TV and comfy bed. The view (from 7th floor) was great and overlooking pool/waterslide. As mentioned previously, the cabana was not open and I thought the cabana wasn't either but then I saw kids go over and as soon as the gate opened, the water started flowing and they had a great time. So, maybe it's motion sensitive? Also, on club level the evening snacks and morning "continental" -more like full- breakfast were GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Worked for me”
Reviews.Author: jhawkwalk
Reviews.Content: Booked two nights and was pleased with my stay. Room was clean and comfortable. Was away from the hotel for most of the day, so I didn't have time to use the pool or the tennis courts, but all the recreational facilities looked nice and well cared for. Nice public areas, helpful front desk employees and very convenient to the interstate I needed to travel each day. No problems with housekeeping; didn't eat at the restaurant. Some reviewers have mentioned the noise from the interstate, and though I was on the end way from it, I still heard some noise from the surface street on my end. Didn't bother me, but might be a problem for light sleepers. No noise from other rooms or hallway at all, though. Only other drawback I saw was no free Internet. There was a charge both in the business center and for in-room wireless. Don't think I would have been as pleased had I paid full retail, but I got a good rate and found it a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific North Phoenix Location”
Reviews.Author: AZ88
Reviews.Content: I have stayed next door at the Marriott Courtyard many times, and decided to give the Crescent at try. Date of this stay was Mar 28 - 31, 2008. This hotel has excellent freeway access to/from I-17 and is less than a mile from Metrocenter Mall. My room was fairly large by hotel room standards. King Size bed, small sofa and desk. It was well appointed and clean. The bathroom was larger than most and had granite vanity and tile flooring and tub surrounds. Closet space is double that of the Courtyard. Room service arrives in 15 min., so be ready! If you are a light sleeper, request a room on the East side, as there is some Freeway noise on the West facing rooms. Freeway noise didn't bother me, but it might to others. Will stay here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not the best”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth7
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at this hotel over Easter weekend. It was not really the standard I have experienced in other Sheraton Hotels. The gentleman at check in was very irritated with the computer and as a result was far from pleasant with us - not a great first impression. We were lacated on the club floor and the room was fine - bed very comfortable. Concierge very helpful. Overall the hotel was nothing special and I don't think I would go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Conference Hotel; Mediocre Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Vivendi4
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference, so I did not select this hotel on my own. Nor would I have if given the choice. The rooms were adequate, although I asked for a different one after checking in so I wasn't just staring at the rooftop. My king room was plenty spacious and nicely appointed with a comfy bed, but on closer inspection, it was pretty dated and several things were broken (lock on sliding door, button on phone to call front desk, clothes line in bathroom, outlet in bathroom that would barely hold my blow dryer plug.) All rooms are non-smoking, but you can still smell the stale evidence of it's smoking past. The pool area was uninspired but nice and the pool was sparkling clean. Sun on the pool area only in the morning hours -- it is in full shade all afternoon. Very fun looking waterslide separate from the pool, although I saw no one use it at all. Tennis courts right by pool. The conference facilities and service were quite good, although the food was just okay. Hotel restaurant had very limited, yet overpriced, choices. I didn't personally pay for my room, but the charge was $139 per night, which seemed reasonable. Location was less than appealing, with nothing handy within walking distance. There is a walking trail along a canal behind the hotel. Not too scenic, but at least there was somewhere to walk between meetings. Otherwise the area is very industrial and right next to the freeway. I never would have stayed here on my own. Not what you would expect from Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Acceptable Choice for Business travel primarily”
Reviews.Author: LusaMD
Reviews.Content: I was speaking at a nearby conference site. The hotel is standard business, nice appearance in lobby and the rooms. My King bed room was smaller than most, but everything was nice. I didn't spend much time other than sleeping and doing some work in the room, but had an enjoyable overnight. The front desk was very helpful in suggesting nearby restaurants, particularly in recommending an inexpensive, local, very authentic Mexican restaurant nearby. For business travelers or families visiting Phoenix or Scottsdale for a short stay, this is a good, acceptable choice. If one wants a more relaxing stay for more than a night or two, the numerous resort hotels are a better choice, whether on business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but nothing exciting”
Reviews.Author: wwills
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a nice outward appearance and an attractive lobby. The woman who checked me in was civil but not overly friendly. She indicated I was staying two nights - and I told her it actually was one night and she didn't say anything. Then when I received my key, it had a large sticker on it saying that early checkout could result in a fee. So I had to call down to the desk and indicate I was checking out in one day. Then when I checked out, they said "oh, you're checking out early" and I had to remind them that twice I had let them know of my early departure. Pretty frustrating. The room is fairly large by hotel room standards. King Size bed, small sofa, desk, etc. There's a $10/day Internet charge. I didn't use it so I can't speak of it's quality. Coffee in the room, as well as the customary ironing board and iron. There is also a small safe in the closet. The condition of the main room was nice. Bed was comfortable and looked relatively new. The bathroom had paint and ceiling tile that was chipped off in the shower making it looked water soaked. It was in pretty rough shape. The tile had spotty mold on the grout. I ordered room service and it arrived promptly (15 mins). I ordered the chicken caesar salad and some ice tea. It was expensive, but tasted fine. I left the tray outside the room and it was still there in the morning. The hotel is very quiet. I didn't hear any noise at all and I woke up a number of times (couldn't sleep for other reasons). There is no shuttle from the airport to the hotel so you have to take a cab. The cost of the cab was approximately $37. In general, this is an average venue. The group I was with had dinner in the hotel's restaurant and said the food was average but it took two hours to dine there because of the slow service. There are nearby venues (Marriott's and Hilton's) that I would suggest you use before opting for this Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: yeckenr
Reviews.Content: No hot water, spotty internet, generally old hotel without any attention to detail. Should not be a part of the SPG/ Starwood programs. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: SSTSF
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel, certainly not a great hotel, maybe a decent, clean choice if the rate was right........ except for the following: first, on our stay, the pool was filthy. Lots of scum and debris floating on the surface as if no one had skimmed it for a couple days. You never see this in a first rate hotel. Second, bathrooms are pretty old and tired. I'm talking 1950s tile bathtubs. Uninspiring. But free parking (a rarity these days), and comfortable beds, easy access to I 17, maybe at $75 this is a 'go'. High season rates might make me gag.

Reviews.Title: “Never, never again”
Reviews.Author: NakedRhino
Reviews.Content: We booked this last minute and rather blindly. In retrospect Spring Training is not the bes time to look for "deals" in Phoenix, but we grossly overpaid for the quality of the property (even for a busy time) at about $200/night after all taxes and fees ($405 total for Friday and Saturday). The location is pretty much out in the middle of nowhere--right on the highway. It somewhat worked for us because we were all over the city as well as most of the surrounding suburbs. Getting anywhere nice for dinner was a minimum 20 minute drive (conservatively). Not to insult Holiday Inn, but that's more the level this property performed at. The Highs: Staff was great (except for the Valet that never showed up to park the car, but garage parking is a 90 second stroll and probably easier) providing some GREAT restaurant recommendations--don't miss Marcellino's!!!! Balcony faced the mountains at sunset, but obstructed by highway lights. Room decor was about what was expected from a Sheraton. The Lows: Our room faced the highway. Even with the THICK drapes closed it was nearly impossible to get to sleep due to the highway noise. Although EXACTLY what I've seen in other Sheraton properties, the colors in the bathroom seem a little more outdated. The tile around the tub was mid-1980's at best (an irritating pinkish-orange to match the marble of the sink). The worst part had to be the mold in the grout. Nice touch. . .

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but Older”
Reviews.Author: amc0323
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Crescent was a fine hotel but there are some things you should be aware of before deciding to book there. The hotel is MUCH older than it appears on the website. If this is an issue for you then don't stay here. I should also note that my experience with "Club Level" perks in other hotels have been far better than at the Sheraton Crescent. The alcohol is not free (about $4.50 for a domestic beer) and the evening hour'dourves were nothing to get excited about (cheese cubes, veggies, chips and salsa, etc.). Unless you like being on "Club Level" for other reasons than the lounge I would not spend the extra money here. I would also like to note that I stayed in a Jr. Suite and requested a king size bed. It was not a king size bed, it was a queen that folded out of the wall, comfortable but not what I had in mind. Finally, I called concierge for a recommendation on where to eat in Downtown Phoenix. I was then transferred to someone else that informed me that he is not from Phoenix and was not familiar with Downtown. I asked if he could find someone that was and was told he would call me back. I never heard from him. In my past experiences that is what concierge is for, they even make reservations for you. Checking in was a breeze and the rooms were clean. I would recommend this hotel for a couple of nights stay if you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel but not a luxury hotel. Again, the website can be a little deceiving when it comes to the appearance of the hotel. It wasn’t a disaster but disappointing when you get there and nothing seems to be the way it was presented to you. Hope this helps in making your decision on where to stay in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Okay place to stay, not the best”
Reviews.Author: Katharine G
Reviews.Content: So I picked this hotel because it was a good price and I like Starwood properties. I was very disappointed by my stay. They book a lot of parties and the music and pepole were constantly loud. The hotel staff was not friendly when we checked in or out, but did give us helpful information when we asked. Our bed was the best part of the trip very comfy. The room other then that was lacking. It had bad lighting, and for the first night NO hot water. I would not spend money here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Pro55
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here while visitng my elderly parents for Thanksgiving. On check-in, I asked about an upgrade as they had said they were pretty empty for the holiday. The room they gave us was larger, but it was more for business entertaining. It had an odd Murphy bed, the TV didn't face either a chair (there was no couch) or the bed, and it wasn't at all inviting. We went back to their standard room, which turned out to be just fine. As usual, the hotel gift shop items were overpriced ($3 for a bottle of OJ) but that's the price of convenience. And altough the CyberCenter off the lobby says "Compliments of the Sheraton Crescent," the Internet services are not free as the word implies; they come with the usual charge, whether you're using your own laptop or their desktops. On the very positive side, all staff members were courteous and helpful, one problem with a slow-running drain was quickly attended to, the hotel was close to I-17 and MetroCenter (big shopping mall) and generally well-kept. Next time we're in Phoenix, we'll definitely look into the Crescent again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Business Meeting Location”
Reviews.Author: TomJr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group meeting. The staff was very accommodating. The meeting areas were clean and well lit. My room was quite nice and very comfortable. The food at the business functions was very good. Overall a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “great staff and water slide”
Reviews.Author: jchasan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great stop over for people traveling across the US. If you want a great bed, great water slide, and super staff you have found your overnight stop. We arrived from San Diego at the time the resturant and bar were closed, we had a 9 year old with us and asked the bar tender for a piece of bread and butter, it was too hot to go out and look for a resturant, she was so nice and brought our son a warm cinnamon muffin while we waited for the resturant to open. When my husband inquired about their nonworking hotspot, they immediately upgraded our room to a business room and provided him with a cable to connect. Great service. The water slide was fun for the whole family and no lines.

Reviews.Title: “The Others have got it wrong”
Reviews.Author: Felpham
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sheraton in late May. Being Starwood Gold Members, we were allocated a room on the club floor. My main reason for writing is because when we arrived after a long flight from London UK, we found the reception staff to be very friendly and exceptionally helpful. We stayed for one night before travelling around Arizona. We did return there for a further two nights at the end of that week. Again we found the staff excellent, they even remembered our names and especially in assisting us with checking in for our next flights of our holiday. I would agree that if you were looking for pool facilities etc, they were a little on the small side. I would have no hesitation in using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I was very disappointed.......”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in this Hotel. The staff at the concierge is the only "Highlight".. They were very courteous and helpful. It is a joke that for an addition $30.00 a night they "include" breakfast. (It has been a long time since toast & cereal costs $30.00). And even a "Holiday Inn Express" has the Disney Channel (without having to pay extra money). $2.95 to watch a 20 minute show.

Reviews.Title: “Not for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: sam_m_ward
Reviews.Content: This hotel is set far outside of the city center in a wasteland of tract homes and strip malls. During my stay, there was never more than one desk clerk on duty and as a result, there was a constant line at the front desk. Even worse, despite advertising a "business center" the hotel has nothing but an internet bar and does not provide access to a copier printer or fax.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for business--not for fun”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel has decent rooms and if you are in Phoenix for business this is all you need. It is nice to receive a complimentary paper (everyday minus Sunday) and if you stay inside the hotel you will be pleased with the decor and style. The beds are quite comfortable! If you are planning on using the internet, be prepared to pay $16/day which I found outrageous! Now, if you are hoping to enjoy and relax at this hotel--it is definitely not a resort--stay in Scottsdale for that! The pool was quite small and quite dirty--the water slide is not staffed continually and you have to find staff to turn it on and monitor it--it also dumps into a small area that is only for the slide...not a place to have fun and relax and enjoy around the pool. We also happend to know more about the area than the concierge and the front desk staff was quite rude. Quite disappointing for those areas.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a large, elegant hotel with great ammenities. I particularly liked the down comforters and comfortable beds. The pool was great, as were the exercise facilities. The rooms were bright and cheery and had been recently renovated. They were always very clean, although one time I saw a cockroach in my bathroom -- I'll chalk that up to a freak occurance, since everything was very clean and well maintained. I have stayed at a couple of other hotels in the area (Courtyard, Fourpoints), and this one is my preference by far. I found that the prices seemed to fluctuate quite a bit (forcing me to use other hotels in the weeks when it went up) -- not sure what that was about.

Reviews.Title: “Multiple Great Stays”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the 3rd time in recent months stayed at the Sheraton Metro Center, off Dunlap Ave and the Black Canyon Freeway (I-17 N). Received upgraded status on 2nd and 3rd stays in addition to the normal Gold Member service that have come to expect from Sheraton Hotels. Great service, very friendly staff and they serve an excellant complementary full American style breakfast. Easy access to the Metro Center Mall as well as easy via I-17 to Phoenix Sly Harbor Airport. Will definitely stay again when in Phoenix area.

HotelInfo.Name: Sheraton Crescent Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 2620 West Dunlap Avenue, Phoenix, AZ 85021
